required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cardiovascular Risk Factors, Maximal Oxygen Uptake and Sedentariness: an Observational Study
clinical_study.official_title: Correlation Between Cardiovascular Risk Factors, Sedentary Behaviors and Maximal Oxygen Uptake in an Elderly Norwegian Population

lead_sponsor.agency: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: This is a substudy of the Generation-100 study (NCT01666340). The aim of this study is to find critical values for (1) maximal oxygen uptake and (2) sedentary behavior, below which cardiovascular risk parameter clustering is apparent in an elderly Norwegian population.

primary_outcome.measure: HDL blood correlation to maximal oxygen uptake
primary_outcome.description: Maximal oxygen uptake test on the bike or treadmill

primary_outcome.measure: LDL blood correlation to maximal oxygen uptake
C-reactive protein (CRP) correlation to maximal oxygen uptake

secondary_outcome.measure: sedentariness correlation with maximal oxygen uptake

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ability to walk at least 1km,
- born in 1938,1939,1940,1941 or 1942
- Sufficiently good health to be able to take part in the study, as determined by the researchers
Exclusion Criteria:
- â€¢Illness or disability that precludes exercise or hinders completion of the study
- Uncontrolled hypertension
- Symptomatic valve disease, hyper tropic cardio-myopathy or unstable angina
- Active cancer
- Test results indicating that study participation is unsafe
- Inclusion in other studies conflicting with participation in this one

overall_official.affiliation: Norwegian University of Science and Technology

facility.name: Norwegian University of Science and Technology
